etymologies: Old English standan (verb), stand (noun), of Germanic origin, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin stare and Greek histanai, also by the noun stead

definitions: have or maintain an upright position, supported by one's feet

examples.text: Lionel stood in the doorway
she stood still, heart hammering
to improve your balance, practice standing on one foot

notes.text: no object, usually with adverbial of place

shortDefinitions: have or maintain upright position, supported by one's feet

definitions: rise to one's feet

examples.text: he pushed back his chair and stood

shortDefinitions: rise to one's feet

definitions: move to and remain in a specified position

examples.text: she stood aside to let them enter

shortDefinitions: move somewhere in upright position

definitions: place or set in an upright or specified position

examples.text: don't stand the plant in direct sunlight

notes.text: with object and adverbial of place

shortDefinitions: place or set in upright or specified position

definitions: (of an object, building, or settlement) be situated in a particular place or position

examples.text: the town stood on a hill
the hotel stands in three acres of gardens

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of place

shortDefinitions: be situated in particular place or position

definitions: (of a building or other vertical structure) remain upright and entire rather than fall into ruin or be destroyed

examples.text: after the heavy storms, only one house was left standing

shortDefinitions: remain upright and entire rather than fall into ruin or be destroyed

definitions: remain valid or unaltered

examples.text: my decision stands
his strikeout record stood for 38 years

shortDefinitions: remain valid or unaltered

definitions: (especially of a vehicle) remain stationary

examples.text: the train now standing on track 3

shortDefinitions: remain stationary

definitions: (of a liquid) collect and remain motionless

examples.text: avoid planting in soil where water stands in winter

shortDefinitions: collect and remain motionless

definitions: (of food, a mixture, or liquid) rest without disturbance, typically so as to infuse or marinate

examples.text: pour boiling water over the fruit and leave it to stand for 5 minutes

shortDefinitions: rest without disturbance

definitions: (of a ship) remain on a specified course

examples.text: the ship was standing north

shortDefinitions: (of ship) remain on specified course

definitions: be in a specified state or condition

examples.text: since mother's death the house had stood empty
sorry, darling—I stand corrected

shortDefinitions: be in specified state or condition

definitions: adopt a particular attitude toward a matter or issue

examples.text: students should consider where they stand on this issue

shortDefinitions: adopt particular attitude towards matter or issue

definitions: be of a specified height

examples.text: Sampson was a small man, standing 5 ft. 4 in. tall

shortDefinitions: be of specified height

definitions: be in a situation where one is likely to do something

examples.text: investors stood to lose heavily

shortDefinitions: be in situation where one is likely to do something

definitions: be at a particular level, value, or stage

examples.text: the budget stood at $14 million per annum
you can use the chart to create a report of where the project stands

shortDefinitions: be at particular level

definitions: act in a specified capacity

examples.text: he stood watch all night

shortDefinitions: act in specified capacity

definitions: (of a stallion) be available for breeding.
shortDefinitions: be available for breeding

definitions: withstand (an experience or test) without being damaged

examples.text: small boats that could stand the punishment of heavy seas

shortDefinitions: withstand experience or test without being damaged

definitions: be able to endure or tolerate

examples.text: I can't stand the way Mom talks to him

shortDefinitions: be able to endure or tolerate

definitions: be a candidate in an election

examples.text: he stood for parliament in 1968
she stood as an Independent candidate in the general election

shortDefinitions: be candidate in election

definitions: provide (food or drink) for (someone) at one's own expense

examples.text: somebody in the bar would stand him a beer

shortDefinitions: provide food or drink for someone at one's own expense

phrases.text: stand on one's own two feet
will the real — please stand up

definitions: an attitude toward a particular issue; a position taken in an argument

examples.text: the party's tough stand on welfare
his traditionalist stand

shortDefinitions: attitude towards particular issue

definitions: a determined effort to resist or fight for something

examples.text: this was not the moment to make a stand for independence
we have to take a stand against racism

shortDefinitions: determined effort to resist or fight for something

definitions: an act of holding one's ground against or halting to resist an opposing force

examples.text: Custer's legendary last stand

shortDefinitions: act of holding one's ground against or halting to resist opposing force

definitions: a rack, base, or piece of furniture for holding, supporting, or displaying something

examples.text: a microphone stand

shortDefinitions: rack, base, or piece of furniture for holding, supporting, or displaying something

definitions: a small stall or booth in a street, market, or public building from which goods are sold

examples.text: a hot-dog stand

shortDefinitions: small stall or booth in street, market, or public building

definitions: a raised platform for a band, orchestra, or speaker.
shortDefinitions: raised platform for band or speaker

definitions: the place where someone typically stands or sits

examples.text: she took her stand in front of the desks

shortDefinitions: place where someone stands or sits

definitions: a place where vehicles, typically taxicabs, wait for passengers

examples.text: a taxi stand
the terminal's facilities include additional aircraft parking stands

shortDefinitions: place where vehicles wait for passengers

definitions: a witness box

examples.text: Sergeant Harris took the stand

shortDefinitions: witness box

definitions: a large raised tiered structure for spectators, typically at a sports arena

examples.text: her parents watched from the stands

shortDefinitions: large raised tiered structure for spectators

definitions: a cessation from motion or progress

examples.text: the train drew to a stand by the signal box

shortDefinitions: cessation from motion or progress

definitions: each halt made on a touring theatrical production to give one or more performances.
shortDefinitions: each halt made on touring theatrical production to give one or more performances

definitions: a group of growing plants of a specified kind, especially trees

examples.text: a stand of poplars

shortDefinitions: group of growing plants of specified kind

phrases.text: stand on one's own two feet
will the real — please stand up
